meanings.definition: To build or create something again after it has been damaged or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the community worked together to reconstruct their homes.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew will reconstruct the bridge that was washed away in the flood.
meanings.sent3: The kids played a game where they had to reconstruct a puzzle blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: She tried to reconstruct the events of the party from the scattered memories in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist used different materials to reconstruct a beautiful sculpture.

meanings.definition: To form an image or idea of something in one's mind based on available information.
meanings.sent1: Using the clues, she tried to reconstruct the suspect's face in her mind.
meanings.sent2: When reading a book, our brains reconstruct the scenes described by the author.
meanings.sent3: He tried to reconstruct the recipe from memory but ended up with a strange dish.
meanings.sent4: The detective reconstructed the crime scene in his mind to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The students had to reconstruct the historical event based on the documents provided.

meanings.definition: To reorganize or rearrange something in a new way.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reconstruct her schedule to make time for her hobbies.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer will reconstruct the living room layout for a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to reconstruct the menu after running out of ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The team had to reconstruct their strategy after the unexpected setback.
meanings.sent5: He had to reconstruct his essay to improve the flow of ideas.
